meanings.definition: Carried or transmitted through the soil.
meanings.sent1: The soilborne disease spread quickly through the garden.
meanings.sent2: Farmers are aware of the risks of soilborne infections in their crops.
meanings.sent3: The soilborne pests had a secret meeting underground.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the plant were like soilborne messengers, passing on the hidden threat.
meanings.sent5: The soilborne contamination was invisible but dangerous, lurking beneath the surface.

meanings.definition: Originating or growing in the soil.
meanings.sent1: The soilborne plants thrived in the rich earth.
meanings.sent2: Mushrooms are a common example of soilborne fungi.
meanings.sent3: The soilborne vegetables threw a party underground.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like soilborne seeds, taking root and blossoming in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The soilborne roots reached deep into the ground, drawing sustenance from below.
